content.prompt: In the third sentence of the first paragraph, the narrator’s description of Mrs. De Ropp as “those three-fifths of the world that are necessary and disagreeable and real” suggests that

choices.label: Mrs. De Ropp is a sensible individual who earns Conradin’s respect
Mrs. De Ropp is a strict person who fails to appreciate Conradin’s creative spirit
Mrs. De Ropp has no real understanding of Conradin’s medical condition
Conradin has no understanding of the value system that Mrs. De Ropp upholds

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
